Key Match Events: Kyle Farmer hit a three-run home run in the second inning.
Matt Wallner hit a solo shot in the third inning and a two-run double in the sixth inning.
Carlos Santana hit a two-run home run.
Pablo López won his fourth straight start with 10 strikeouts over seven innings without an earned run.
Zach Neto hit a three-run homer in the fifth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Pablo López commented on the team's recent struggles and the importance of playing loose and having fun.
Angels manager Ron Washington reflected on the need for a shutdown inning in the fifth but acknowledged the failure to achieve it.
Twins manager Rocco Baldelli humorously mentioned the reappearance of the lucky summer sausage mascot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins stopped a four-game losing streak with this victory.
The Twins preserved a three-game edge in the chase for the last of three AL wild-card spots.
Angels' 3B Anthony Rendon and RHP Ben Joyce were placed on the injured list.
Twins' CF Byron Buxton, SS Carlos Correa, RF Max Kepler, and OF Manny Margot took live batting practice before the game.
